title: What is the best online music synthesizer tutorial? - Quora

response.answer_text: In my opinion, nothing even really comes close to this: The Ultimate Synthesizer Tutorial Syntorial is a training program that uses a real softsynth to teach you based on the way the timbre YOU design sounds and not necessarily what oscillator or settings you've specifically selected (as you get into it past the basics where “pushing the right button" does matter). It's reasonably priced and is the fastest way to go from complete novice to “proficient" in almost no time. I'm not peddling the product and have no stake or interest in it or the company other than the fact that as a user, it helped me. Here's a video showing more:

Without knowing specifics about what you are interesting in studying, I suggest the following link:  http://www.soundonsound.com/articles/Technique.php There's a ton of info available via the many links. You'll find a very thorough series of posts explaining sound creation, which while particularly helpful to analogue synthesis, will help the reader understand what digital synthesis is attempting to replicate. http://www.soundonsound.com/sos/allsynthsecrets.htm- Scroll down to the bottom of the page to start at "Part 1: What's in a Soumd?" Happy synthesizing!!
